alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Mason (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 8:16PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kimble and southwestern Mason Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 816 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of The Intersection Of I-10 And Us 290, or 7 miles east of Segovia, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Kimble and southwestern Mason Counties. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 467 and 475. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
